articles.title: Measles confirmed in unvaccinated child in Nassau County, health officials report
articles.description: Nassau County health officials did not disclose the age or hometown of the child.
articles.content:
An unvaccinated child in Nassau County has a confirmed case of measles, Nassau health officials reported Saturday, the state’s first measles case outside of New York City and the third case statewide this year.

articles.title: 4 things nobody tells you about watching a loved one die of cancer
articles.description: When cancer spreads too far and chemotherapy and radiation no longer work, doctors stop treatment and the patient’s real pain begins.
articles.content:
Life is sadly not as Hollywood portrays it to be.
Many people may think that when they walk into a hospital, they’re on an episode of “Grey’s Anatomy,” but that is far from reality.

articles.title: Why It Feels Like You Lose The Will To Live Between 3-5 PM Every Day
articles.description: If you have frequently found yourself feeling restless and out of energy between 3-5 p.m. every day, you're not alone. The afternoon slump occurs due to the body's circadian rhythm, but there are ways to feel more energized by tackling the problem at the source through proper nutrition, exercise, and other healthy habits.
articles.content:
If you have noticed that your energy levels seem to dip excessively between 3 and 5 p.m., you’re not alone.
Instead of pouring yourself another cup of coffee to combat the mid-afternoon slump, it might be time to face the sleepy problem at the source... [5427 chars]

articles.title: A new treatment plan may help patients streamline their medical visits
articles.description: “We don’t talk enough about what we’re asking older adults to do and whether that’s realistic,” one expert says.
articles.content: Susanne Gilliam, 67, was walking down her driveway to get the mail in January when she slipped and fell on a patch of black ice. Pain shot through her left knee and ankle. After summoning her husband on her phone, she made it back to the house with d... [7224 chars]

articles.title: Supplement Scientist Shares 4 He Takes for Heart Health, Inflammation
articles.description: A supplement scientist who researches the claims products make for a living shares the four he takes for heart health and inflammation daily.
articles.content:
Richard Bloomer researches the health claims supplement manufacturers make for a living.
He said there are some great ingredients out there that can be used alongside a healthy lifestyle.

articles.title: Chicago reports 2 more measles cases, bringing total to 17
articles.description: How contagious is measles? A Chicago measles outbreak has risen to 17 total cases, the department of public health said on Friday.
articles.content:
East Chicago Health Department investigating possible mass exposure at Indiana church, but has not linked it to Chicago cases

articles.description: Cancer doesn't care how old you are. That statement was especially true for a young mother of two from the Treasure Coast who received an unexpected diagnosis.
articles.content:

articles.title: Life expectancy rises for first time in two years
articles.description: Life expectancy in the United States began to rebound in 2022, jumping to 77.5 years old after a two-year dip, data published Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) showed.
articles.content:
Well, it’s a start.
Life expectancy in the United States began rising from COVID-era lows in 2022, jumping to 77.5 years old after a two-year dip, data published Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) showed.
